question_text:
The point N(-2,-6) is reflected over the x-axis. What are the coordinates of the resulting point, N'?
N' = (_, _)
backend_description: The image shows a coordinate grid labeled from -6 to 6 on both axes. A blue point labeled N is located in the third quadrant at (-2, -6). A red horizontal line is drawn across the x-axis, suggesting a reflection over the x-axis.
solution: Start with the point N(-2,-6) and the x-axis.
Reflect the point over the line.
Since N is 6 units below the x-axis, N' is 6 units above the x-axis. N' has coordinates (-2,6).
solution_image_tag: The image shows a coordinate grid labeled from -6 to 6 on both axes. A blue point labeled N is located in the third quadrant at (-2, -6). A red horizontal line is drawn across the x-axis, suggesting a reflection over the x-axis.
The image shows the same coordinate grid with the blue point N now reflected over the x-axis. The new light blue point N' is located at (-2, 6) in the second quadrant.
